author: Jane Harper RETAIL
title: Former Myer CEO Bernie Brookes gets $1.5 million golden handshake despite declining sales
text:
FORMER Myer boss Bernie Brookes enjoyed a $1.5 million golden handshake after stepping down from the helm of the retailer on the back of sliding sales.
The termination payment boosted Mr Brookes’ total pay and perks package to $4.25 million
for 2015, according to the retailer’s annual report.
It was a 65 per cent increase on his total package the previous year of $2.57 million, despite full-year sales at the department store slumping 21 per cent.
Mr Brookes, who stepped down in March after eight years in the top role, saw his base salary increase to $2.3 million, up from $1.8 million a year earlier.
Mr Brookes has since been named as chief executive for South African retailer Edcon.
He was replaced at Myer in March by former information chief Richard Umbers, whose received a $1.5 million pay and perks package.
This included a base salary of $792,000, and a $590,000 signing-on bonus. He was also awarded
$400,000 in performance rights, which vest in 2017.
Mr Umbers in September unveiled a $600 million five-year turnaround plan — dubbed New Myer — which includes closing as many as 13 of its 67 stores, shuffling in-store space to make room for the most popular brands, tailoring product mix to local demographics and revamping the shopfloor appeal.
Mr Umbers said the fresh strategy was crucial to stem years of declining sales as the department store faces new competitors and changing shopper behaviour.
Myer shares closed up 0.5c at 89.5c yesterday.
 Brookes bags $1.5m golden handshake
